00039 template<class T, void(T::*Tmethod)()>
00040 class Timer {
00041 public:
00042   Timer(T *owner, time_t interval = 0, bool trigger_on_start = true)
00043       : owner_(owner),
00044         interval_(interval),
00045         last_interval_(interval),
00046         is_running_(false),
00047         trigger_on_start_(true) {}
00048 
00049   ~Timer() {
00050     // we could let Thread cancel the loop in ~Thread, but we
00051     // prefer to ensure we don't access stale data.
00052     if (is_running_) {
00053       should_run_ = false;
00054       interrupt();
00055     }
00056   }
00057 
00058   void start(time_t interval, bool trigger_on_start = true) {
00059     ScopedLock lock(mutex_);
00060     trigger_on_start_ = trigger_on_start;
00061     last_interval_ = interval_;
00062     interval_ = interval;
00063     if (is_running_) {
00064       should_run_ = false;
00065       interrupt();
00066       thread_.join();
00067     }
00068     thread_.startThread<Timer, &Timer::startThread>(this, NULL);
00069   }
00070 
00071   void start(bool trigger_on_start = true) {
00072     ScopedLock lock(mutex_);
00073     trigger_on_start_ = trigger_on_start;
00074     if (is_running_) {
00075       should_run_ = false;
00076       interrupt();
00077       thread_.join();
00078     }
00079     thread_.startThread<Timer, &Timer::startThread>(this, NULL);
00080   }
00081 
00082   void stop() {
00083     ScopedLock lock(mutex_);
00084     if (is_running_) {
00085       should_run_ = false;
00086       interrupt();
00087       thread_.join();
00088     }
00089   }
00090 
00091   void join() {
00092     if (is_running_)
00093       thread_.join();
00094   }
00095 
00096   time_t interval() {
00097     return interval_;
00098   }
00099 
00102   void setInterval(time_t interval) {
00103     ScopedLock lock(mutex_);
00104     last_interval_ = interval_;
00105     interval_ = interval;
00106     if (is_running_) {
00107       interrupt();
00108     }
00109   }
00110 
00111   void stopFromLoop() {
00112     should_run_ = false;
00113   }
00114 
00115   void setIntervalFromLoop(time_t interval) {
00116     last_interval_ = interval_;
00117     interval_ = interval;
00118   }
00119 
00120   bool isRunning() const {
00121     return is_running_;
00122   }

00124 private:
00125   void run() {
00126     time_t wait_duration;
00127     time_t now;
00128     // time_ref_.elapsed() is our time anchor
00129     time_t next_fire = time_ref_.elapsed() + (trigger_on_start_ ? 0 : interval_);
00130     struct timespec sleeper;
00131 
00132     while (should_run_) {
00133       { ScopedLock lock(mutex_);
00134 
00135         now = time_ref_.elapsed();
00136 
00137         // This can be used to ensure test...
00138         // printf("logical: %li real: %li wait: %li\n", next_fire, now, wait_duration);
00139 
00140         if (next_fire > now) {
00141           // interrupted
00142           // we do not fire on interval change
00143           next_fire -= last_interval_;
00144         } else {
00145           // trigger
00146           // TODO: add 't' value (loop count from start so that we can be informed if
00147           // some occurences had to be skipped).
00148           (owner_->*Tmethod)();
00149           now = time_ref_.elapsed();
00150         }
00151 
00152        /* Timer sync issues:
00153         * We compute the new logical fire and sleep to sync real trigger as close as we can.
00154         */
00155         next_fire += interval_;
00156 
00157         wait_duration = next_fire - now;
00158         if (wait_duration < 0) {
00159           if (interval_ > 0) {
00160             // this can happen if we changed interval_ during sleep
00161             // next_fire + k * interval_ > now
00162             int k = ((now - next_fire) / interval_) + 1; // +1 because we need to respect '>'
00163             // skip 'k' occurences
00164             next_fire += k * interval_;
00165             wait_duration = next_fire - now;
00166           } else {
00167             // run as fast as we can
00168             // we could limit this to 1ms...
00169             wait_duration = 0;
00170           }
00171         }
00172 
00173         sleeper.tv_sec  = wait_duration / 1000;
00174         sleeper.tv_nsec = (wait_duration % 1000) * 1000000; // 1'000'000
00175       }
00176 
00177       nanosleep(&sleeper, NULL);
00178     }
00179 
00180     is_running_ = false;
00181   }
00182 
00183   static void interruptSleep(int sig) {
00184     // we need to reregister signal
00185     signal(SIGUSR1, Timer::interruptSleep);
00186     // we just interrupted sleep, let the loop continue
00187     return;
00188   }
00189 
00192   void interrupt() {
00193     thread_.sendSignal(SIGUSR1);
00194   }
00195 
00196   void startThread(Thread *runner) {
00197     signal(SIGUSR1, Timer::interruptSleep);
00198     should_run_ = true;
00199     is_running_ = true;
00200     runner->highPriority();
00201     runner->threadReady();
00202     run();
00203   }
